perturbation.original_text: Distributor agrees to comply with all applicable laws and regulations, both foreign and domestic, in its performance under this Agreement, including, but not limited to, domestic and foreign export/import laws and regulations.
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor agrees to comply with some laws and regulations, both foreign and domestic, in its performance under this Agreement, including, but not limited to, domestic and foreign export/import laws and regulations.
perturbation.explanation: By changing "all applicable laws" to "some laws", the contract introduces ambiguity and contradiction. It is unclear which laws the distributor must comply with, weakening the enforceability of the clause related to legal compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies depending on the specific laws not complied with due to the ambiguity. Generally violates principles of contract law requiring clarity and certainty.

perturbation.original_text: Jurisdiction for litigation of any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, or the breach thereof shall be only in the Federal or the State court with competent jurisdiction located in Stamford, Connecticut.
perturbation.changed_text: Jurisdiction for litigation of any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, or the breach thereof shall be determined by mutual agreement between the parties; if no agreement is reached, it will be in the Federal or the State court with competent jurisdiction located in Stamford, Connecticut.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction by first stating that the jurisdiction will be in Stamford, Connecticut but then allowing for another jurisdiction if there is a mutual agreement. The original text clearly defines jurisdiction to be Connecticut but the alteration makes that a conditional statement that is not readily enforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic Principles of Contract Law regarding Clarity and Enforceability

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement is not assignable by either party hereto without the prior written consent of the other, except that this Agreement shall be assignable by Developer to an affiliated entity or upon the sale of the fight to license and sublicense the Products to the purchaser of said right.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement is assignable by either party without consent. This Agreement is not assignable by either party hereto without the prior written consent of the other, except that this Agreement shall be assignable by Developer to an affiliated entity or upon the sale of the fight to license and sublicense the Products to the purchaser of said right.
perturbation.explanation: The added statement at the beginning "This Agreement is assignable by either party without consent," is in contradiction with the original text. The original text states assignment is only possible with written consent but the change allows the agreement to be assigned by either party regardless of consent. This would cause disputes over which section is upheld.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic Principles of Contract Law regarding Clarity and Enforceability
